citeinfo.origin: Department of the Interior (DOI), National Park Service (NPS), Land Resources Division (LRD), Pacific West Land Resources Program Center
citeinfo.title: Mojave National Preserve Tract and Boundary Data

pubinfo.publish: National Park Service Land Resources Division

descript.abstract: These ESRI shape files are of National Park Service tract and boundary data that was created by the Land Resources Division. Tracts are numbered and created by the regional cartographic staff at the Land Resources Program Centers and are associated to the Land Status Maps. This data should be used to display properties that NPS owns and properties that NPS may have some type of interest such as scenic easements or right of ways.
descript.purpose: This data is intended to keep a record of ownership information. Tracts can represent several types of interest like fee and scenic easement, and can be under several types of ownership like NPS owned, private, other federal, state or county. This data set provides accurate and reliable ownership data for park management and acquisition priorities.

timeperd.current: Beginning date is the first recorded conveyance date. Ending date is set to the last day the data set was updated.

theme.themekt: National Park Service Theme Category Thesaurus

place.placekt: National Park System Unit Name Thesaurus
National Park System Unit Code Thesaurus

idinfo.useconst: NPS Director's Order #25 states: "Land status maps will be prepared to identify the ownership of the lands within the authorized boundaries of the park unit. These maps, showing ownership and acreage, are the 'official record' of the acreage of Federal and non-federal lands within the park boundaries. While these maps are the official record of the lands and acreage within the unit's authorized boundaries, they are not of survey quality and not intended to be used for survey purposes." As such this data is intended for use as a tool for GIS analysis. It is in no way intended for engineering or legal purposes. The data accuracy is checked against best available sources which may be dated and vary by location. NPS assumes no liability for use of this data. The boundary polygons LRD creates represent the current legislated boundary of a given NPS unit. NPS does not necessarily have full fee ownership or hold another interest (easement, right of way, etc...) in all parcels contained within this boundary. Equivalently NPS may own or have an interest in parcels outside the legislated boundary of a given unit. In order to obtain complete information about current NPS interests both inside and outside the units legislated boundary, the tracts file created by LRD should be used in conjunction with this boundary file created by LRD.

cntorgp.cntorg: NPS - Land Resources Division, WASO -Fort Collins, CO

idinfo.citeinfo: Microsoft Windows XP - Service Pack 2, Autodesk Land Desktop 2006 Project (DWG format)

attracc.attraccr: The Tract_id, and Alpha data fields are provided by regional cartographic offices. The Date_Edit data field is added when the regional office submits the data to the Lands WASO Fort Collins office for inclusion in the national data set. All remaining tract attributes are updated from LRD's Master Deed Listing (MDL) nightly. By default the Status and Estate fields are included shape file dbf. All other MDL fields covered under the FOIA can be added to the tract dbf upon request.

dataqual.logic: Link and node polygon topology is created using Autodesk Civil3D 2015 project.. The data is then exported to ESRI shape file format and reprojected from it's native Autodesk coordinate system to NAD83 generic latitude and longitude, LL83.
dataqual.complete: Information contained in LRD's land ownership databases is updated nightly however tract polygons are posted to the NPS Data Store on a monthly basis. Users can ensure parcel polygons have up to date ownership attribution after the publication date by contacting your regional LRD office or downloading the Current_Tract_Ownership_Data file located on the NPS Data Store (http://science.nature.nps.gov/nrdata/) in a dBase format. Please contact the data originator with any suggested corrections and updates. LRD's boundary polygons represent the current legislated boundary of a given NPS unit. NPS does not necessarily have full fee ownership or hold another interest (easement, right of way, etc...) in all parcels contained within this boundary. Equivalently NPS may own or have an interest in parcels outside the legislated boundary of a given unit. In order to obtain complete information about current NPS interests both inside and outside the units legislated boundary, LRD's tracts files should also be downloaded and used in conjunction with LRD's boundary files.

horizpa.horizpar: It is estimated that this data sets meets National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:100,000 scale data. That is, 90 percent of all points tested are within 1/50th of an inch (167 feet).

procstep.procdesc: Minor revisions was done on 9/15/2020. No revision was made to the boundary. Tract 160-03 was divided into three tracts. The geometry Tracts 144-49 and 144-50 was adjusted (See C.O. # 114). The topology was updated on 9/18/2019, tract 144-14 was divided into three tracts and Tract 192-22 was divided into two tracts. PUBLIC LAW No. 116-90 (03/12/2019) Natural Resources Management Act boundary of preserve was adjusted to include 25.00 acres of of Bureau of Land Management land located in Baker, California. So the tract topology also was updated to included the new tract. Tract 114-35 made up three county parcels 0544-291-114 (10.00 ac.), 0544-291-16 (5.00 ac.) and portion of 0544-351-06 (5.00 ac.) All parcels are described as an aliquot parts in Sections 19 and 30 of T 14 N, R 9 E, San Bernardino Base & Meridian. a Only the tract topology was updated due to the acquisitions of 96 tracts done in February of 2017. A minor discrepancy of an aliquot parts description was found by a BLM geographer, therefore boundary of preserve was modified. The discrepancy was located on the E-W south-south 1/64 centerline of Section 10, T 14 N, R 17 E, San Bernardine Base & Meridian. The boundary was moved 660 feet easterly on said centerline from C-S-SE 1/64 corner of said section to SE-SE-1/64 corner of Section 10 to be consisted with legal description of the preserve. The layer of Tract 109-03 was revised from Tract to Tract-Sec. There were four individual tracts each tract was divided into two tracts. The boundary between Tracts 197-14 and 197-15 was revised. Boundary adjustment published in the Federal Register on June 14, 2013 [NPS-PWR-MOJA-12321; PS.SMOJA0003]. SUMMARY: Notice the boundary of Mojave National Preserve is modified to include 7.12 acres of improved land identified as Tract 103-28 and to exclude 48.14 acres of improved land identified as Tract 114-05. The entire line work of park boundary and the individual tracts were re-drawn based on the latest BLM CadNSDI PLSS Data a geodatebase for State of California (FGDB dated 09/19/2011). In process of re-mapping of the digitized centerlines of the Kingston Road and Nipton Road was done in ArcGIS. Cogo-ing hardcopies of right-of-way maps of Interstate 15 and Interstate 40. These right-of-way maps were provided by the Department of Transportation of the State of California (CALTRANS District 8). Park boundary of the park in NW portion is right-of-way of Interstate 15 and in southern portion is the right-of-way of Interstate 40. ROW linework in section 1 of T 15N R 11E, sections 5 and 6 T 15N R 12E, and sections 24, 25, 26, 27, 31, 32, and 33 of T 16N R 12E were rotated around the section corner common to sections 17, 18, 19, and 20 of T 16N R 12E 1 degree. ROW linework in section 22 T 15N R 14E, and sections 32, 33, and 34 T 16N R 14 E was rotated around the west quarter corner of section 22 T 15N R 14E 0d 40'. ROW linework in sections 1, 2, 11, 14, 15, 21, and 22 T 13N R 8E was rotated around the section corner common to sections 25, 26, 35, and 36 of T 14N R 8E 0d40'. ROW linework in section 36 T 14N R 8E and sections 20, 29, 30, and 31 T 14N R 9E were rotated around the section corner common to sections 16, 17, 20, and 21 T 14N R 9E 0d25'. ROW linework in sections 1, 10, 11, 15, 16, and 21 T 14N R 9E, section 6 T 14N R 10E, and sections 31 and 32 T 15N R 10E were rotated around the corner common to sections 16, 17, 20, and 21 T 14N R 9E 1d. ROW linework in sections 28 and 29 T 15N R 10E were rotated around the corner common to sections 28, 29, 32, and 33 T 15N R 10E 1d. ROW linework in sections 13, 22, 23, and 24 T 15N R 10E, and sections 8, 9, 10, 11, 17, and 18 in T15N R 11E were rotated around the corner common to sections 21, 22, 27, 28 T 15N R 10E 1d. Tracts 153-04, 153-05, 153-06, 153-07, 153-08, 153-09, 153-10, 153-11, 153-14, 153-15, 153-16, 153-17, 153-18 and portion of 143-03 were transformed X = 7267289.24, Y = 2199939.78 (NE corner of Sec.25) and 7261917.55, Y = 2194560.90 (SW corner of Sec. 25) to account for the ground to grid translation. All of these tracts located in Sec. 25, T. 11 N, R12 E., S.B. B. & M. Two transformed points were derivated from GCDB Data. Tract 118-01A rotated around 1°23’46.54674” from Latitude 35°18” 55.765” N and Longitude 115°33’01.681”W (NAD 83). Tract 103-28 is outside the park boundary and it’s described in the California State Plane Coordinate System of 1983, Zone 5 same as cad file for Mojave NP. NAD83 California State Planes, Zone 5, US Foot was used as the source coordinate system for the Autodesk Civil3D 2012 project. The Autodesk line work is imported, edited, attributed, approved, and a link and node topology is developed both for the tract and boundary data layers according to the procedures described in the Land Acquisition Procedures Manual Chapter 5. The entire unit is created in a geographically contiguous model space and separate layouts representing each individual segment map are created. The tract and boundary data is then reprojected to North American Datum 1983 generic latitude & longitude and exported from Autodesk to an ArcView shape file format in a single step. This data dates back to 2004. It was first made available in 2016.

Update 03212019: Tract and boundary topologies were updated to include 25.00 acres added to preserve per change order #112 Tract 114-35. The tract topology was updated to reflect the changes in change order 8386-11. It was discovered that the parcels had not been assigned separate NPS tract numbers, and that their acreage was mistakenly lumped in with tract 104-01.

distinfo.distliab: Property ownership data is compiled from deeds, plats, surveys, and other source data. These are not engineering quality drawings and should be used for administrative purposes only. The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
distinfo.custom: To get a hard copy plot, contact Land Resources Program Center for replacement costs and turnaround times.

Tracts are numbered and created by the regional cartographic staff at the Land Resources Program Centers and are associated to the Land Status Maps. This data should be used to display properties that NPS owns and properties that NPS may have some type of interest such as scenic easements or right of ways.

Tracts can represent several types of interest like fee and scenic easement, and can be under several types of ownership like NPS owned, private, other federal, state or county. This data set provides accurate and reliable ownership data for park management and acquisition priorities.

Consts.useLimit: NPS Director's Order #25 states: "Land status maps will be prepared to identify the ownership of the lands within the authorized boundaries of the park unit. These maps, showing ownership and acreage, are the 'official record' of the acreage of Federal and non-federal lands within the park boundaries. While these maps are the official record of the lands and acreage within the unit's authorized boundaries, they are not of survey quality and not intended to be used for survey purposes." As such this data is intended for use as a tool for GIS analysis. It is in no way intended for engineering or legal purposes. The data accuracy is checked against best available sources which may be dated and vary by location. NPS assumes no liability for use of this data. The boundary polygons LRD creates represent the current legislated boundary of a given NPS unit. NPS does not necessarily have full fee ownership or hold another interest (easement, right of way, etc...) in all parcels contained within this boundary. Equivalently NPS may own or have an interest in parcels outside the legislated boundary of a given unit. In order to obtain complete information about current NPS interests both inside and outside the units legislated boundary, the tracts file created by LRD should be used in conjunction with this boundary file created by LRD.

These are not engineering quality drawings and should be used for administrative purposes only. The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. report.measDesc: Link and node polygon topology is created using Autodesk Civil3D 2015 project.. The data is then exported to ESRI shape file format and reprojected from it's native Autodesk coordinate system to NAD83 generic latitude and longitude, LL83.

Information contained in LRD's land ownership databases is updated nightly however tract polygons are posted to the NPS Data Store on a monthly basis. Users can ensure parcel polygons have up to date ownership attribution after the publication date by contacting your regional LRD office or downloading the Current_Tract_Ownership_Data file located on the NPS Data Store (http://science.nature.nps.gov/nrdata/) in a dBase format. Please contact the data originator with any suggested corrections and updates. LRD's boundary polygons represent the current legislated boundary of a given NPS unit. NPS does not necessarily have full fee ownership or hold another interest (easement, right of way, etc...) in all parcels contained within this boundary. Equivalently NPS may own or have an interest in parcels outside the legislated boundary of a given unit. In order to obtain complete information about current NPS interests both inside and outside the units legislated boundary, LRD's tracts files should also be downloaded and used in conjunction with LRD's boundary files.
